column1: # P00: aggregation-paradox - Collective preference aggregation is logically inconsistent - team scoring produces mathematically invalid rankings
# P01: missing-customer-voice - System captures team assumptions about problems/needs
column2: not validated customer behavior or willingness to pay

column1: # P02: cost-blindness - Ranks by strategic importance but ignores implementation cost
# P03: time-blindness - Treats features as independent choices
# P04: risk-ignorance - All relationships scored as if outcomes were known
column2: no modeling of execution risk or market uncertainty

column1: # P05: competitive-blindness - No awareness of competitors
# P06: scoring-subjectivity - Relationship scores are fuzzy opinions that can be gamed or manipulated for political purposes

column4: and anchoring biases distort scoring without awareness

column1: # P08: static-analysis - Analysis becomes outdated as customer needs
# P09: feedback-loop-gaps - Can't predict how solving problems changes behavior

column4: or homogeneous teams produce confidently wrong answers

column1: # Format: strength or strength(count) where count is number of observations
